text: Grow a short boxed beard to add definition and width to your jawline.
Lower body fat percentage to reveal natural jaw structure.
Your strong jawline is a key asset—keep it clean-shaven or with light stubble to show it off.
Mewing exercises (proper tongue posture) can help enhance jawline definition over time.
Consider jaw-focused exercises like chin tucks and neck curls to strengthen the area.
Opt for hairstyles with volume on top (e.g., Pompadour) to elongate your face.
Square or rectangular glasses frames will add necessary angles.
Avoid high-volume hair on top; choose styles with fullness on the sides.
Glasses with more depth (height) help balance facial length.
Soft, layered hairstyles can balance your strong angular features.
Round or oval glasses frames contrast well with your face shape.
Avoid very short sides; keep some length on the sides to soften the face shape.
Avoid very short sides to balance wide cheekbones.
Fringes or textured crops can help soften a narrow forehead.
Most hairstyles and glasses suit you—experiment with bold styles!
Longer hairstyles or beards can help fill out the lower face.
Hairstyles with volume on top and sides help balance a wider jaw.
Select glasses with a bridge width that complements your eye spacing.
Focus on quality sleep to reduce puffiness that exaggerates eye asymmetry.
Contouring or specific camera angles can help balance nose proportions.
Strategic facial hair placement can draw attention away from nose proportions.
Professional grooming/threading can easily correct eyebrow asymmetry.
Lip balm and hydration can improve lip symmetry appearance.
Maintain good posture to enhance your natural presence.
A consistent skincare routine is the best way to improve overall facial aesthetics.
Stay hydrated—water intake directly affects skin quality and facial fullness.
Regular cardiovascular exercise improves facial blood flow and skin tone.
Keep lips moisturized to enhance their natural definition.
Use sunscreen daily to prevent premature aging and maintain skin quality.
Regular haircuts every 3-4 weeks maintain your optimal face-framing style.
